## Housekeeping

- HW for next week: create a study guide outline for the final written and practical exams (details in Google Classrom)


## Learning objectives

- Follow SOPs to measure a vertical light profile, YSI parameters, and secchi depth
- Collect water samples
- Follow SOPs to filter water samples for chl *a* and TSS
- Describe common sources of PAR, secchi, and YSI sampling error and explain whether values would be over- or under-estimated
- Describe common sources of TSS and chl *a* sampling error and explain whether values would be over- or under-estimated

## Supplies & equipment

- dock lines
- field data sheets
- pencils
- clip boards
- LI-COR
- YSIs
- nalgene bottles 
- secchi disks
- filtering gear (vacuum pump, manifold and filtering cup, forceps, filters, foils, skinny sharpies, plastic baggie, DI bottles)


## Procedures

1. Filtering slides
1. Calibrate YSIs 
1. Knot tying on the dock with dock lines
1. Demo LI-COR, secchi, YSI, collecting water samples from the floating dock
1. Everyone: YSI measurements
1. In River Center lab, demo filtering for TSS & chl *a*
1. One group go get a water sample and come back up to the lab to filter
1. One group go to the dock and measure secchi and collect a vertical light profile with the LI-COR
1. Switch! 
1. Enter data in [data spreadsheet](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1FwTsPz89F6rkB8VK9UGrjffrvfalvkeT?usp=sharing)
